boat.full_description:
Martlet's history is hazy but we believe (from research kindly undertaken by Nic Compton) that she was a prototype for a possible new design class for Emsworth Yacht Club in 1948. The design was not taken forward therefore she remains a one-off.

Martlet was purchased by the current owner's father in the 1970s and she was a much-loved family dinghy for many years. Although based in Berkshire, the family took their annual family holiday in Helford in Cornwall and the current owner has many happy memories or learning to sail in Martlet on the Helford river as a child.  The current owner now lives in Helford and Martlet is permanently based there.

Martlet was substantially rebuilt and beautifully refurbished by Ashley Butler of Butler & Co in Penpol, Cornwall between 2017 and 2020 and she now looks as lovely as she would have done when she was first built (if not better!)
boat.name: Martlet
boat.short_description: Martlet is a beautiful varnished clinker dinghy from the 1940s.
